pageContext.claim: “The abuses were all over. As just one example, people were forbidden from giving or receiving religious items at a military hospital where our brave service members were being treated, and when they wanted those religious items.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump appears to be pointing to an outdated controversy over a poorly worded September 2011 policy at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center. The policy was intended to prevent proselytizers from harassing patients, but was so poorly worded that lawmakers raised concerns it would ban visitors from bringing religious items for servicemembers. The hospital quickly rescinded and revised the policy, and apologized for the confusion.
